required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Refitting Daily Disposable Contact Lens Wearers With Dry Eye Disease With A Different Daily Disposable Lens Type
clinical_study.official_title: Refitting Daily Disposable Contact Lens Wearers With Dry Eye Disease With A Different Daily Disposable Lens Type

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to refit habitual wearers of daily disposable contact lenses who currently experience symptoms of dry eye and discomfort during lens wear with a different type of daily disposable contact lens. Ocular signs and symptoms of dry eye will be assessed following the guidelines outlined by the Tear Film and Ocular Surface Society (TFOS) in the Dry Eye Workshop II (DEWS II). The performance of the habitual contact lenses and the study lenses will be determined using different optometric assessments. Study lenses will be worn for one month following a daily disposable wear schedule.

study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will be masked to the lens type (brand) they will be wearing during the study in order to reduce bias towards or against this product

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective Comfort at End of Day with contact lens wear
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 after screening with habitual lenses
primary_outcome.description: Participants rate their end of day comfort on a scale from 0 (worst) to 100 (best).

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective Comfort at End of Day with contact lens wear
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 3 after screening with habitual lenses
primary_outcome.description: Participants rate their end of day comfort on a scale from 0 (worst) to 100 (best).

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective Comfort at End of Day with contact lens wear
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 5 after screening with habitual lenses
primary_outcome.description: Participants rate their end of day comfort on a scale from 0 (worst) to 100 (best).

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective Comfort at End of Day with contact lens wear
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1-week follow up with habitual lens
primary_outcome.description: Participants rate their end of day comfort on a scale from 0 (worst) to 100 (best).

arm_group.description: All study participants will be refit with Delfilcon A (Dailies Total 1) lenses which they will wear for 1 month.

intervention.description: Participants wear delafilcon A contact lenses on a daily disposable basis.
